Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is able to return the horizontal and vertical sum of an open tile, keep track of the row and column index of an open tile, and generate the possible set of numbers that a user could enter for a specific open tile.
    Since:
    11-16-2017
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    skyso, matthewri

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameLogic​(Tile[][] board)
      This method constructs this GameLogic object which uses a SumGenerator object to create the clue for an open tile

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> calcTile​(int rowInd, int colInd)
      This method calculates the possible values that could be entered in this open tile based on its horizontal and vertical sums

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic​(Tile[][] board)
        This method constructs this GameLogic object which uses a SumGenerator object to create the clue for an open tile
        Parameters:
        board - - a 2-d Array representing the tiles in a board

    • Method Detail

      • calcTile

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> calcTile​(int rowInd,
                                                       int colInd)
        This method calculates the possible values that could be entered in this open tile based on its horizontal and vertical sums
        Parameters:
        rowInd - - an int representing the row index of this open tile
        colInd - - an int representing the column index of this open tile
        Returns:
        returns an ArrayList of integers that represent all the possible values that can be entered in this open tile
